==Notable alumni==

[[File:Lou-boudreau.jpg | thumb|Hall of Famer [[Lou Boudreau]]]]
 
* [[Jim Ard]] was an [[NBA]] player and member of the [[1976 NBA Finals|1976 NBA Champion]] [[Boston Celtics]].<ref name="Sun-Times Spotlight">{{cite web|url=http://www.suntimes.com/sports/preps/highschool/335558,CST-SPT-spot11.article |title=''Thornton Pride Stays With You'', April 11, 2007, ''Chicago Sun-Times''; accessed November 23, 2008 |publisher=Suntimes.com |date= |accessdate=January 31, 2011}}</ref>
* [[Jim Ard]] was an [[NBA]] player and member of the [[1976 NBA Finals|1976 NBA Champion]] [[Boston Celtics]].<ref name="Sun-Times Spotlight">{{cite web|url=http://www.suntimes.com/sports/preps/highschool/335558,CST-SPT-spot11.article |title=''Thornton Pride Stays With You'', April 11, 2007, ''Chicago Sun-Times''; accessed November 23, 2008 |publisher=Suntimes.com |date= |accessdate=January 31, 2011}}</ref>
* [[Lloyd Batts]] was a basketball player for the [[Cincinnati Bearcats men's basketball|University of Cincinnati]] who played one season with the [[American Basketball Association|ABA]] [[Virginia Squires]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.basketball-reference.com/players/b/battsll01.html |title=Lloyd Batts stats and bio, Basketball-reference.com; accessed November 23, 2008 |publisher=Basketball-reference.com |date=May 9, 1951 |accessdate=January 31, 2011}}</ref>
